description: A traditional method of cooling drinking water using clay pots, known as Matka, which utilizes the natural evaporation process to keep water cool.
steps: Store drinking water in a clay pot (Matka).
Place the Matka in a shaded area to enhance cooling.
Elevate the Matka on a stand for better air circulation.
Cover the mouth of the Matka with clean cloth to prevent dust and insects.
Change the water daily to avoid algae growth and unpleasant odors.
Reverse the Matka weekly to maintain its effectiveness.
risks: Potential for contamination if not covered properly.
Algae growth if water is not changed regularly.
